thread.title: AKA celebrates 75 Years of sisterhood and service to community in North Alabama
thread.title_full: AKA celebrates 75 Years of sisterhood and service to community in North Alabama

author: Nakell Williams
title: AKA celebrates 75 Years of sisterhood and service to community in North Alabama
text: WAAY 31 evening anchor Nakell Williams will serve as emcee of the Legends' Ball hosted by Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated â€“ Epsilon Gamma Omega Chapter and Gammu Mu Chapters as they celebrate 75 years of outstanding service in the Huntsville/Madison County area, the Southeastern region, and across the world. In celebration of 75 years of service and sisterhood, the Epsilon Gamma Omega Chapter will host a Pearls and Pretty Girls Sunset Soiree from 4 to 8 p.m. Friday at Stovehouse Event Center. Get ready to indulge in a sophisticated evening filled with music, delectable hors d'oeuvres, and fantastic company. The grand finale event will commence on Saturday at The Legends Ball: Diamond Jubilee of Legends- Celebrating 75 Years of Soaring to Greater Heights. The black-tie event will be at the Von Braun Center Saturn Ballroom. The event will be an extraordinary, memorable, and monumental evening of honoring our "Living Legends." It will include live music, entertainment, dinner, and dancing. All proceeds from both events will be dedicated to scholarships and service programs that will allow the organization to empower and uplift the community.
